newsitem.title: FINLAND: NOKIA EXTENDS GAINS AFTER AT&T ORDER.
newsitem.headline: NOKIA EXTENDS GAINS AFTER AT&T ORDER.

text.p: Shares in Finnish telecommunications major Nokia extended earlier strong gains in lively trade on Thursday after news of a $240 million contract with U.S. telecoms group AT&T, brokers said.
After the news, Nokia rose to a session-high of 210.50 markka -- its highest since December last year. By 1515/1215 GMT, it had eased slightly to 209.00 markka, still up 6.70 or 3.31 percent.
Volume was active at over 120 million markka.
"There is no doubt that it was news of the deal that moved the share," one broker said.
Nokia said in a statement it had signed a contract to deliver dual band and dual mode handsets with AT&T Wireless Services for a value of $240 million over three years.
